roleset.name: be more than

example.name: just transitive
example.text: But the automotive parts and aerospace concern expects that net for the year ending Nov. 30 will exceed last fiscal year's net of $70 million, or $2.19 a share, primarily because of $200 million in gains from sales of discontinued operations.
example.arg: net for the year ending Nov. 30
last fiscal year's net of $70 million, or $2.19 a share

example.name: margin, as PP
example.text: It expects to post a loss of 6.4 billion yen for the year ending tomorrow and its liabilities currently exceed its assets by about 13.8 billion yen.

example.name: margin as adverb
example.text: David J. Lothson, an industry analyst for PaineWebber Group Inc., said Johnson & Johnson's results slightly exceeded his expectations for the third quarter.
example.arg: his expectations for the third quarter

roleset.note: Frames file for 'exceed' based on sentences in financial subcorpus; adjectival 'excessive' based on BOLT-7. Member of VNcls exceed-90-1.

example.name: adjectival rel: excessive
example.text: Although it-1 appears *PRO*-1 to be extravagant or excessive , normally , it would be more realistic and meaningful to stress on " Do n't do evil . "
